title: Ginger Garlic Steamed Whole Fish

ingredients.content: 6 green onions (4 whole, 2 cut into pieces)
2 whole fish, gutted, cleaned, e.g. Branzino (approx. 24-32 oz total)
2 ½ oz ginger, peeled (2 oz thinly sliced, 0.5 oz cut into ¼ in. pieces)
½ tsp dried chili flakes, to taste

preparations.content: Cut parchment to fit Varoma tray (see Tip). Scrunch parchment into a ball under running water, squeeze out excess water and lay onto Varoma tray.

Arrange 4 whole green onions onto Varoma tray. Season fish inside and outside with salt. Stuff fish cavities with thinly sliced ginger (approx. 1 oz ea.). Place prepared fish over green onions, ensure Varoma lid closes securely and set aside.

Place garlic, 2 cut green onions, 0.5 oz cut ginger, cilantro, chili flakes, black bean chili sauce, rice wine and sesame oil into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté <b>2 min/212°F/speed 0.5<b>.
Evenly spread ginger-garlic mixture over prepared fish and set aside.
Place 20 oz water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>20-22 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, until fish is cooked through.
Transfer steamed fish onto a serving platter, reserving sauce from parchment to pour over the fish. Garnish with cilantro and serve immediately with lime wedges and Chinese chives.

hintsAndTricks: To cut parchment to fit Varoma tray: tear off a piece of parchment wide enough to cover Varoma tray. Place Varoma tray on top of parchment and cut around the tray to form an oval shape.
Serve fish hot, topped with fresh pea shoots or chopped cilantro.
Marinate fish 15-20 minutes before steaming to allow flavors to develop.
